Patients had travel and residence history in epidemic area within 2 months before onset.
Patients had direct or indirect contact with rats or their excreta (faeces, or urine), secretions, etc. within 2 months prior to onset of disease.

In the febrile period, there were increased white blood cell counts and thrombocytopenia in peripheral blood, and abnormal lymphocytes appeared. Blood concentration (hypotensive shock stage) or hemodilution (oliguria stage)
Urine protein positive, may appear under the microscope hematuria, tubular urine. There may be gross hematuria and membrane in urine; Large fused cells can be found in the sediment of urine
Blood creatinine and urea nitrogen were increased Serum specific IgM antibody was positive.
The serum specific IgG titer was 4 times higher in the convalescence phase than in the acute phase.
needs to rely on specific serological examination.
It occurs in the winter and spring season, or the body or clothing of patients often has body lice.
The detection of Rickettsia prowazek antibody in the serum samples of patients serves as a serological diagnosis of epidemic typhus.

In the Weil-Felix reaction, the serum OX 19 bacterial strain agglutination titer was greater than 1:160, and the serum agglutination titer increased by 4 times or more with the increase of the disease course, which was a positive test of antibody for typhus infection.

Indirect immunofluorescence test was performed on the serum of patients with known antigens of Rickettsia prowazek. Indirect immunofluorescence test showed that serum antibody titer IgM of Rickettsia prowazek was greater than or equal to 1:40, or IgG was greater than or equal to 1:160, or twice the antibody titer of serum samples was increased by 4 times or more to test positive for typhus infection antibody.
body_text.section: Indirect immunofluorescence assay was used to detect Rickettsia prowazek antibody

body_text.text: The PCR amplification of Rickettsia prowazek DNA fragments from the blood samples of patients was effective and positive for Rickettsia prowazek.
body_text.section: Polymerase linked reaction (PCR) was used to detect the fragment of Rickettsia prowazek gene

body_text.text: Qualified laboratory samples or blood samples were inoculated directly into guinea pigs to isolate Rickettsia prowazek.
2.1. Clinical symptoms：Related clinical symptoms (omitted).
Most of them occur in autumn and winter, but there is no obvious seasonality in temperate and subtropical regions, and most of them have flea contact history or live in rat-infested areas.
The detection of rickettsia mooseri antibody in the serum samples of patients serves as a serological diagnosis of epidemic typhus.

In the Weil-Felix reaction, the serum OX 19 bacterial strain agglutination titer was greater than 1:160, and the serum agglutination titer increased by 4 times or more with the increase of the disease course, which was a positive test of antibody for typhus infection.

Indirect immunofluorescence test was performed on the serum of patients with known antigens of rickettsia mooseri. Indirect immunofluorescence test showed that serum antibody titer IgM of rickettsia mooseri was greater than or equal to 1:40, or IgG was greater than or equal to 1:160, or twice the antibody titer of serum samples was increased by 4 times or more to test positive for typhus infection antibody.
body_text.section: Indirect immunofluorescence assay was used to detect rickettsia mooseri antibody

body_text.text: The PCR amplification of rickettsia mooseri DNA fragments from the blood samples of patients was effective and positive for rickettsia mooseri.
body_text.section: Polymerase linked reaction (PCR) was used to detect the fragment of rickettsia mooseri gene

body_text.text: Qualified laboratory samples or blood samples were inoculated directly into guinea pigs to isolate rickettsia mooseri.
Based on the epidemiological data, clinical symptoms and laboratory test results, a comprehensive analysis of suspected diagnosis and clinical diagnosis was made.

Based on the epidemiological history, clinical manifestations and laboratory examination, the diagnosis was made.
Due to the window period of detection, antibody detection, nucleic acid detection and HIV virus isolation test should be comprehensively applied in laboratory detection according to the situation.

The results of the screening test are responsive, suggesting that HIV antibodies may be positive, which needs to be confirmed by further supplementary tests. The results of the screening test showed no response and HIV antibody was negative.

body_text.section: Determination of HIV antibody confirmation test results

body_text.text: 1) At least two env bands (gp41 and gp160/gp120) appear, or at least one env band and at least one gag or pol band appear simultaneously;
body_text.section: Determination of HIV antibody confirmation test results

body_text.text: 2) It meets the positive criteria provided by the state-approved HIV antibody confirmation kit.
body_text.section: Determination of HIV antibody confirmation test results

body_text.text: B) HIV-2 antibody positive (+) shall meet one of the following criteria:
body_text.section: Determination of HIV antibody confirmation test results

body_text.text: 1) There are at least two env belts (gp36 and gp140/ gp105).
body_text.section: Determination of HIV antibody confirmation test results

body_text.text: 2) In line with the positive criteria provided by the state-approved HIV antibody confirmation kit.
body_text.section: Determination of HIV antibody confirmation test results

body_text.text: C) Negative HIV antibody (-): there is no specific band of HIV antibody. D)HIV antibody uncertainty (±): specific bands of HIV antibody appear, but not enough to determine positive.
body_text.section: Determination of HIV antibody confirmation test results

body_text.text: Positive results were confirmed and HIV antibody was reported. The positive test results were negative and HIV antibody was reported. The results of the confirmatory test were inconclusive, and HIV antibody was reported to be inconclusive, and it was suggested to follow up 2 to 4 weeks later or to have HIV nucleic acid test as soon as possible.
body_text.section: Treatment of HIV antibody confirmation test results

BIBREF0.title: Clinical symptoms：Have different subtypes, including H7, H9N2, H10N7, and H5N1. Related clinical symptoms (omitted)

BIBREF3.title: Epidemiological history: Had contact with suspected or clinically or laboratory-confirmed SARS cases 14 days before onset, especially close contact with them

BIBREF4.title: Cases have clear evidence of transmission to others, especially to multiple persons who have been diagnosed with suspected or clinically or laboratory-confirmed SARS cases

BIBREF5.title: Had history of contact with masked civet or related wildlife within 14 days prior to onset of illness, such as having been to the premises and environment where masked civets or related wildlife are raised, sold, transported, processed or cooked, and having direct contact with their secretions and/or excreta

BIBREF6.title: B) Those with 5 item and etiological examination of trachea and bronchial secretions meeting the requirements of 4.1.a item or

BIBREF7.title: A) Having 3 item and meeting the requirements of 4.3 item in pleural hydrothorax or pleural pathology examination

BIBREF8.title: B) Those that have 3.3 item and pleural effusion and meet the requirements of 4

BIBREF9.title: Source of diagnostic criteria, detailed testing methods, instruments, procedures, etc

BIBREF10.title: CPs/mL suggested that HIV infection, negative cannot exclude HIV infection

BIBREF11.title: Immunological test is the main test index for the staging of HIV infection and AIDS and the evaluation of efficacy, mainly using CD4+T lymphocyte test, divided into CD4+T lymphocyte count and percentage

BIBREF12.title: This was suitable for adults and children over 5 years old. The CD4+T lymphocyte count in this group was ≥500/mm3, indicating no immune deficiency. 350/mm3-499/mm3 indicated mild immunodeficiency

BIBREF13.title: For children aged 5 years and under. The percentage of CD4+T lymphocytes in peripheral blood T cells in this group was > 35%

BIBREF14.title: 12 months old ~ 36 months old), or > 25% (37 months old -60 months old), indicating no immune deficiency.30%-35% (< 12 months of age), or 25%-30% (12 months of age-36 months of age), or 20%-25% (37 months of age ~ 60 months of age)

BIBREF16.title: Source of diagnostic criteria, detailed testing methods, instruments, and procedures, etc

BIBREF17.title: Contact history: Patient has received treatment of blood, blood products or other human tissues, cell components, or organ transplantation; A history of hemodialysis, unsafe injection or other invasive operations, such as surgery, endoscopy, endoscopy, puncture, catheter, intubation, oral treatment, acupuncture, beauty treatment, tattoo, pedicure, etc.; previous history of paid blood supply; a history of B) The clinical manifestations are characteristic of chronic hepatitis C

BIBREF18.title: C) Liver histopathological examination shows the characteristics of chronic hepatitis C

BIBREF19.title: D) Imaging and other auxiliary examinations are characteristic of chronic hepatitis C

BIBREF20.title: E) Acute hepatitis c has been ruled out with an epidemiological history or unknown duration of infection

BIBREF21.title: Hepatitis C cirrhosis: both anti-HCV and HCV RNA are positive and meet any of the following criteria: A) The clinical manifestations are characteristic of hepatitis C cirrhosis

BIBREF22.title: B) Liver histopathology showed the characteristics of hepatitis C cirrhosis

BIBREF23.title: C) Imaging and other auxiliary examinations are characteristic of hepatitis c cirrhosis

BIBREF24.title: Source of diagnostic criteria, detailed testing methods, instruments, and procedures, etc

The results from Seasonal Influenza 1 were based on the full range 2008 to 2017 years without excluding the extreme value in 2009 when the Seasonal Influenza outbreak in China; The results from Seasonal Influenza 2 were based on the full range 2008 to 2017 years but we excluded the extreme value in 2009 when the Seasonal Influenza outbreak in China. The results from Schistosomiasis 1 were based on the full range 2008 to 2017 years without excluding the extreme value in 2015 when the Schistosomiasis outbreak in China; The results from Schistosomiasis 2 were based on the full range 2008 to 2017 years but we excluded the extreme value in 2015 when the Schistosomiasis outbreak in China.

FIGREF2.text: The national coverage rate of the CISDCP network reporting by year from 2008 to 2017 in township level and county and above level Figure S2. The national coverage rate of the CISDCP network reporting by province in township level and county level and above from 2008 to 2017 (A, D G-county level and above; B, E, H-township level; C, F, I-national total) Flowchart of data filtering and management from the National Notifiable Infectious Disease Surveillance System Figure S4. The annual percentage changes (APC) and turning point in the trend from 2008 to 2017 for total and sevencategories of infectious diseases using the joinpoint regression modelsNote: * represented that the APCs were statistically significant during the study period. Red pots represented the observed incidence of each year. If there was only one fitted trend line with green color, it meant that there were no joinpoints years during the past 10 years. But if there were two fitted trend lines with green and blue color, it meant that there was one joinpoints year during the 10 years using the Joinpoint regression model. * represented the statistical significant trends

FIGREF5.text: The comparison of incidence of seven categories of 44 notifiable infectious diseases in different regions in 2017 Note:** represented the statistical tests were significant using the chi-square test. A total of 31 provinces in mainland of China were classified into seven regions including Northeast (Heilongjiang, Jilin, Liaoning and Inner Mongolia), Eastern China (Shandong, Jiangsu, Shanghai, Zhejiang, Anhui, Jiangxi, and Fujian), Northern China (Hebei, Beijing, Tianjin, and Shanxi), Central China (Henan, Hubei, and Hunan), Southern China (Guangdong, Guangxi, and Hainan), Southwest (Sichuan, Yunnan, Guizhou, Chongqing, and Tibet), and Northwest (Xinjiang, Ningxia, Qinghai, Shannxi, and Gansu).

FIGREF6.text: by typical changes. The cerebrospinal fluid of patients with outbreak shock is usually clear, and the protein, of ecchymosis (spot) tissue fluid and cerebrospinal fluid smear, gram negative renal diplococcus can be found in polynuclear white blood cells or outside cells. 3.3.2 Neisseria meningitidis was positive in cerebrospinal fluid, blood and tissue fluid of stasis (spot). 3.3.3 The specific nucleic acid of neisseria meningitidis tested positive in cerebrospinal fluid, blood and tissue fluid of petechiae specific polysaccharide antigen of neisseria meningitidis was tested positive for cerebrospinal fluid samples in the acute phase.

Late recessive syphilis: infection time in more than 2 years. Those unable to determine the time of infection is also considered as late recessive syphilis.

TABREF2.text: The domestic classification of current notifiable infectious diseases in China Influenza A H1N1 was listed into Group B in April 30th of 2009, but incorporated into seasonal influenza of Group C since November of 2013. SARS, Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome; AIDS, Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndrome; HFMD, Hand, Foot, and Mouth Disease; Dysentery, Bacillary Dysentery and Amoebic Dysentery

TABREF3.text: Health Commission of China. All notifications of targeted infectious diseases, according to the International Classification of Diseases (ICD 10) were verified by recording staff. Records that indicate a misdiagnosis or false reporting are removed to ensure accurate and complete data. The diagnostic procedures, instruments, reagents and imaging features involved in each standard are available in the links of each disease: http://wsbz.nhc.gov.cn/wsbzw/BzcxAction.do?dispatch=goBzgg Table S5. Summary of diagnostic criteria for 44 notifiable infectious diseases in the laboratory tests

TABREF8.text: 1 Smear gram staining microscopic examination Clinical suspected patients take secretions, smear, gram staining microscopic examination, the typical multicellular leukocyte gram negative diplococcus. Microscopic examination of positive urethral secretions in male gonococcal urethritis with obvious urethral symptoms has diagnostic value. See URL below. 3.2 Neisseria gonorrhoeae culture Urethral or cervical secretions or other clinical specimens are taken for neisseria gonorrhoeae culture, from which typical morphological colonies with positive oxidase test can be isolated. Take bacterial colony to do smear examination, visible gram negative dicoccus, glucose fermentation test decomposition glucose, does not decompose other sugars.3.3 Neisseria gonorrhoeae nucleic acid testSamples of urine, urethra or cervical secretions were collected and tested positive for gonococcal nucleic acid (See URL below).Most had a history of unsafe sex, or a history of sexual infection, or multiple sexual partners. A history of primary or secondary syphilis may be present. The duration of illness is more than 2 years. Cerebrospinal fluid examination (mainly used for the diagnosis of neurosyphilis) White blood cell count ≥10×106/L, protein content > 500mg/L, and no other cause for these abnormalities. The CSF VDRL test (or RPR/TRUST test) or fta-abs test (or TPPA/TPHA test) is positive.

TABREF10.text: The confirmed cases: 8. Source of diagnostic criteria, detailed testing methods, instruments, and procedures, etc: "WS 273-2018" replacing "WS 273-2007" (Health Industry Standard of China) http://wsbz.nhc.gov.cn/wsbzw/upload/StandardLibrary/7ac0b3790c8742b7821dd7ddf56394a0.pdf 9. Release and implementation time HIV/AIDS 1. Clinical symptoms：Related clinical symptoms (omitted). Having a history of sexually transmitted diseases 2.2 Having unsafe sex (including homosexual and heterosexual sexual contact) 2.3 History of drug abuse with shared syringes 2.4 History of iatrogenic exposure 2.5 Occupational exposure histories 2.6 Spouse or sexual partner of HIV/AIDS patients 2.7 Children born to HIV/AIDS mothers

TABREF11.text: Pathogen detection 3.3.1 HIV isolation test HIV infection is reported by positive test results, while HIV infection cannot be ruled out by negative test results.
